title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: SpaceX unveils $17B plan for satellite network
items.summary:
- **SpaceX** signs a $17B deal to acquire EchoStar airwave licenses to create a *mobile satellite network* offering seamless service in remote areas without extra hardware. 
- The plan expands **Starlink** to connect directly to mobile devices, building a *direct-to-cell constellation* that could pressure rivals like AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon. 
- **SpaceX** expects chipsets to be modified to talk to Starlink satellites and is pursuing partnerships in India with telcos and data centers.

items.title: CEA warns of banking risks from power plant closures
Meta gets into power trading as AI sends demand soaring
items.summary:
- *Meta Platforms* is seeking authorization to participate in *wholesale power trading* to manage its data-centre electricity needs via its *Atem Energy* subsidiary.
- As *AI energy demand* soars, big techs like *Meta Platforms*, Microsoft and Google face rising electricity costs and can hedge by using on-site batteries or generators to sell power back to the grid.
- *Louisiana regulators* approved *Entergy's* plan to build natural gas plants for Meta's largest data centre, while *Meta Platforms* has filed with *FERC* through *Atem Energy* to market power.

items.title: BARC's reactor for Navy's next-gen submarines
items.author: Srinivas Laxman
items.summary:
- **BARC** is developing a *200 MWe* reactor to boost endurance of Indiaâ€™s next-gen submarines, enabling longer submerged operations.
- The design aims to surpass the current *83 MWe* capacity on INS Arihant and INS Arighat, strengthening second-strike capability within the nuclear triad.
- This effort fits into broader plans for domestic nuclear reactors, including **SMRs** and other advanced designs.

items.title: MADC approves 220 acre for Solar Mihan project
items.summary:
- **MADC** approved 220 acres in *Mihanâ€‘SEZ* to **Solar Defence and Aerospace Limited** (SDAL) for a mega defence and aerospace project, pegged at over â‚¹12,700 crore and expected to create about 6,800 jobs. 
- A separate project to manufacture transport aircraft and defence equipment is proposed, expected to add around *875* more jobs. 
- The land allotment is among the largest in **Mihan-Sez** and followed the MoU signed with the state government during the *World Economic Forum* in Davos; Solar Group also has stakes in the commercial explosives business.

items.title: Reducing imports in hydrogen production: Saraswat
items.author: Dr. V.K. Saraswat
items.summary:
- India aims to cut hydrogen import dependency under the *Hydrogen Mission*, targeting 5 mt by 2030 and expanding *green hydrogen* plants and electrolyzers.
- R&D boosts hydrogen storage, charging stations, highâ€‘pressure cylinders, and private SMR participation; nine hydrogen centers and Tata infrastructure underway.
- *Green hydrogen* costs about $4â€“5/unit today; reforms to cut electrolyzer and power costs, promote **blue hydrogen**, and build domestic materials, aided by international collaborations and a **hydrogen alliance**.

items.title: Russia offers localisation of large & small NPPs in India
items.summary:
- Russia offered to localise large and small nuclear power plant projects as part of *civil nuclear energy collaboration* between Russia and India.
- Rosatom's director general Alexey Likhachov announced the offer during the IAEA General Conference in Vienna, noting progress at *Kudankulam* NPP and opportunities for serial construction of Russian-designed reactors in India.
- The move aims to leverage India's *industrial capabilities* to deepen energy ties and boost *local manufacturing* of NPPs.

items.title: Nvidia explores $500M investment in Wayve
items.summary:
- Nvidia signs a letter of intent for a potential **$500 million** investment in Wayve.
- Wayve, a London-based autonomous startup, uses *machine learning* with camera sensors instead of maps.
- Nvidia's involvement follows a broader pledge to invest in the British AI startup ecosystem.

items.title: Cochin Shipyard, Mazagon Dock eye TN shipyards
items.author: P Manoj, ETInfra
items.summary:
- *Cochin Shipyard* and *Mazagon Dock* plan MoUs to set up new shipyards in **Tamil Nadu**, with PM Modi present.
- *Cochin Shipyard* will sign with **HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering (KSOE)** for long-term cooperation.
- India aims to expand capacity under *Maritime India Vision 2030*, moving from 0.072 to 0.33 million GT by 2030 and beyond 2047.

items.title: Agentic AI reality check: Why Indiaâ€™s factories are betting on small models and edge AI
Vedanta declared preferred bidder for manganese block in Andhra Pradesh
Oil India, Hindustan Copper sign MoU for exploration of critical minerals
Our efforts are focussed on reducing imports in hydrogen production: NITI Aayog member Saraswat
Explained: How hydrogen is shaping Indiaâ€™s rockets, transport, and clean energy push
Delhi cuts MRPs as GST on drugs and devices drops
items.summary:
- The *Delhi Drugs Control Department* directed manufacturers to revise *MRPs* in line with the new *GST* cuts, making lifesaving medicines and devices cheaper.
- The *GST Council* cut healthcare tax slabs from 12% to 5%; 33 essential lifesaving medicines are now *GST-free*, and medical devices like glucometers will be taxed at 5%.
- Revisions require a *no-objection certificate* from the state licensing authority; savings reach patients (e.g., â‚¹1,000 to about â‚¹950) with labels reflecting the revised price.

items.title: Maharashtra to lead green steel drive: CM Fadnavis
items.summary:
- *Maharashtra* will lead in steel production and play a pivotal role in India's **Green Steel Mission**, in line with PM Modi's vision.
- CM Fadnavis announced projects worth â‚¹80,000 crore and said *Gadchiroli* could become Indiaâ€™s new steel city with major investments.
- The state targets 58% of energy from renewables by 2030 and 16,000 MW of solar power for farmers by 2026, reducing subsidies and industrial tariffs.

items.title: Modi to lay foundation stone for nuclear plant in Rajasthan
items.summary:
- PM Modi will lay the foundation stone for the **Mahi-Banswara Nuclear Power Plant** in *Rajasthan* on Sept 25, also inaugurating projects worth over â‚¹1.21 lakh crore.
- Modi will flag off **Vande Bharat Express** routes (Bikaner-Delhi, Jodhpur-Delhi) and **Udaipur-Chandigarh Express**, boosting *clean energy* initiatives.
- The event will be livestreamed to connect district HQs and gram panchayats; the nuclear project alone is pegged at about â‚¹45,000 crore.

items.title: Intelâ€“Nvidia deal a mixed blessing for Asian chipmakers
items.summary:
- **Nvidia**'s $5B stake in **Intel** and a joint plan to co-develop PC and data-center chips could help **Intel** revive its foundry ambitions.
- For **TSMC** and **Samsung**, Intelâ€™s revival may ease US scrutiny in the near term but could heighten longâ€‘term competition and shift chipâ€‘making dynamics.
- Analysts say the outcome remains uncertain, with Intelâ€™s progress potentially influencing US domesticâ€‘production policy and **Nvidia**/AMD positioning.

items.title: Dorf Ketal in $1.6 bn talks to acquire Italyâ€™s Italmatch from Bain Capital
items.author: Arijit Barman, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Dorf Ketal is in advanced negotiations to acquire **Italmatch Chemicals** SpA from **Bain Capital** for *$1.6 billion*, signaling a major consolidation in the specialty chemicals sector.
- The deal is in exclusivity with terms to be finalized in weeks, potentially expanding **Dorf Ketalâ€™s global footprint** and its adjacencies in water treatment, lubricants and additives.
- Italmatchâ€™s US presence and 20 plants worldwide would complement **Dorf Ketalâ€™s** operations, strengthening the growth plan amid a sector upcycle.

items.title: Ukraine to expand its weapons industry to deter Russia
items.summary:
- Ukraine plans to triple its *weapons production* and cut reliance on *Western partners* amid the war with *Russia*. 
- Drones and robotics, such as FRDM's quadcopter and Gurza armored vehicles, are accelerating Ukraine's battlefield edge with *drones* and *Gurza* systems. 
- Europe and partners are funding *joint ventures* to license and manufacture arms for Kyiv to strengthen *deterrence*.

items.title: Rajasthan to set up 6,000 MW energy storage project
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- *Rajasthan* plans to develop a **6,000 MW** battery energy storage system (BESS) with **central government** support to store daytime renewable energy and supply it at night. 
- MoUs worth â‚¹2,00,800 crore with central undertakings aim to meet future energy needs, covering about **4,895 MW conventional** and **38,343 MW renewable** capacity. 
- Implementation milestones include **500 MW/1,000 MWh** BESS with **Viability Gap Funding (VGF)** targeting completion by December 2026, plus additional allocations and tenders in 2025 for **1,000 MW/2,000 MWh** and **2,000 MWh**.

items.title: Vedanta declared preferred bidder for manganese block in Andhra Pradesh
ISM 2.0: India's $20B chip plan
items.author: Sankara Mahadevan
items.summary:
- *ISM 2.0* expands beyond fabs to include *compound semiconductors*, packaging, and design incentives to build an ecosystem.
- It faces execution risks like policy gaps and delays, but could turn India into a global semiconductor hub with discipline and partnerships.
- The plan highlights *policy stability*, *ease of doing business*, and *talent development* as keys to success.

items.title: NRB Bearings plans learning centre for retirees
items.summary:
- **NRB Bearings** plans an advanced manufacturing centre in *Aurangabad* to train retirees and younger staff as mentors.
- The programme blends retirees with techâ€‘savvy youngsters, turning retirees into trainers and offering a residential sabbatical at the learning centre.
- *Harshbeena Zaveri*, MD, says AI and collaboration will boost productivity by blending technology with experience for a peopleâ€‘centric growth approach.

items.title: Marvell in talks with Indian fabs for chip fabrication
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh
items.summary:
- Marvell is in NDA-protected talks with Indian fabs to outsource chip fabrication in India.
- Vice-President *Rishi Chugh* says the long-term moonshot is a fully made-in-India rack designed, assembled and built domestically.
- India must aim for the *cutting-edge* nodes and **advanced packaging** to attract top talent and ensure future-ready deployments.

items.title: India must bridge gaps in critical mineral ecosystem, says Hindalco CTO
items.summary:
- India must bridge gaps in its mineral ecosystem to achieve self-reliance in *clean energy* and manufacturing, says Hindalco CTO Vilas Tathavadkar.
- He calls for industryâ€“academiaâ€“government collaboration to close value-chain gapsâ€”from exploration to purification and end-use, like *semiconductor manufacturing*.
- He warns of skilled-workforce shortages, emphasizes *recycling*, and urges reforms and an export-minded, scalable policy to build the ecosystem quickly.

items.title: Hind Rectifiers acquires BeLink for â‚¬1 million
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hind Rectifiers acquired *BeLink Solutions*, a France-based company in **robotics** and **EMS**, for â‚¬1 million in cash funded by internal accruals.
- Under the deal, â‚¬2 million will be infused into the subsidiary, with Hind subscribing â‚¬1 million as *preference shares* and the remaining â‚¬1 million as *equity shares*, giving Hind ~66% and promoter 34%.
- BeLink is expected to generate â‚¬13 million in revenue in 2025, with â‚¬10 million in pending orders for 2026, helping Hind Rectifiers establish a *European manufacturing presence* in *robotics* and *EMS*.

items.title: Odisha minister admits fertiliser black marketing
items.summary:
- Odisha's Food & Supplies Minister KC Patra admitted to *black marketing* of **urea**, noting hoarding across the state.
- He claimed stock is sufficient and urged farmers not to panic, with enforcement intensified to curb the practice.
- The OPCC's **Kisan Congress** plans a Sep 23 protest (Bidhan Sabha Gherao) over fertiliser scarcity and government inefficiency.

items.title: India pushes domestic critical minerals for clean energy
items.summary:
- **India** is pushing to expand domestic critical minerals for *clean energy* and advanced manufacturing.
- The push includes policy reforms, private exploration, and the **National Critical Minerals Mission** to reduce imports.
- It aims to secure supply for *EVs*, solar, and semiconductors while ensuring environmental and community safeguards.

items.title: Panasonic is eyeing white goods PLI, all-new India plant
items.author: Shristi Achar, ETtech
items.summary:
- Panasonic is eyeing a new manufacturing unit in **India** to tap the *White Goods PLI* scheme.
- The plan aligns with shifting operations from Japan to India and growing its B2B and consumer segments, highlighted at Electronica India 2025.
- Panasonic is exploring categories under the PLI to unlock the countryâ€™s long-term market potential.

items.title: Smartphone exports jump 55% to 330M devices made in India
items.summary:
- *55% jump* in the first five months of FY 2025-26, with annual production around *330 million devices* and about *1 billion phones in use*. 
- *In Q2 2025, India overtook China to become the top smartphone exporter to the US*, aided by rapid *5G adoption* and strong demand across *mid-range and premium* segments. 
- *The electronics manufacturing sector is moving to deep component manufacturing*, with electronics production rising to *â‚¹11.3 lakh crore* in 2024-25 and Tamil Nadu hosting *47 units* under MeitY schemes.

items.title: Digitisation of aerospace industry needed to scale up
items.summary:
- *Digitisation* is essential to scale up India's aerospace industry to become a *global manufacturing hub*.
- Banmali Agarwala urges Indian firms to absorb and build on technology rather than depend on external sources.
- The discussion calls for moving from prototypes to large-scale production and strengthening domestic tech absorption.

items.title: How Nvidia deal could aid Intelâ€™s next-gen manufacturing
items.summary:
- Nvidia invests about $5B for roughly a 4% stake in *Intel* and the partners will jointly supply chips that connect Intel CPUs with Nvidia GPUs using *NVLink*.
- Intel Foundry will produce the CPUs for the joint products and engineers will translate Nvidia tech into a chip at Intel, potentially advancing **14A** manufacturing.
- Analysts say the deal could improve *Intel*'s position against **AMD**, while providing production volumes to justify **14A** and offering **long-term** significance.

items.title: GST cut on drones to spur adoption and manufacturing
items.summary:
- The GST on unmanned aircrafts is reduced to a uniform **5%**, *boosting adoption* and supporting domestic manufacturing under *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*. 
- A uniform rate eliminates **classification disputes** and provides *policy certainty* for drone investors and operators. 
- Government initiatives such as **Namo Drone Didi**, **Drone Shakti**, National Test House support, and the *Bharat Drone Mahotsav* are expanding the drone ecosystem.

items.title: HD Kumaraswamy urges industries to stay in Bengaluru
items.summary: - *Bengaluru* should retain its industry, as HD Kumaraswamy urged, citing the cityâ€™s legacy and promising to rebuild it with Karnatakaâ€™s people. - He criticized roads and governance, calling Bengaluru the *City of Potholes* and pressing for accountability, while warning firms not to migrate to neighbouring states. - He argued the government is draining funds and urged action to restore *infrastructure*, safeguarding Bengaluruâ€™s investment appeal.

items.title: Thermax & Dassault on India's energy transition
items.summary:
- *Thermax* and *Dassault SystÃ¨mes* leaders map India's energy transition, showing how efficiency and sustainability must align with digital innovation.
- They cite biomass, highâ€‘temperature heat pumps, wasteâ€‘toâ€‘energy and *AI* forecasting plus *digital twins* to cut waste, emissions and boost competitiveness.
- The talk highlights skills development, vendor sustainability and publicâ€“private collaboration as essential to scale solutions nationwide.

items.title: Monolithisch India commissions Capex at Purulia plant
items.summary:
- Monolithisch India has commissioned *Capex-I* at its Purulia plant in West Bengal, lifting capacity to 206,000 TPA in the unshaped refractory materials segment.
- The expansion targets rising demand for *ramming mass products* for India's steel industry and signals growth, adoption of *next-generation technologies*, and sustainability focus.
- MD *Harsh Tekriwal* calls the milestone a "new chapter," with pre-runs and quality checks over the next 10 days to ensure smooth operations.

items.title: Govt serious on defence production via private sector
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The government is *serious* about promoting the *defence production industry* through the *private sector* and welcomes meaningful suggestions.
- *Self-reliance* means wartime independence with full control over technology, supply chains, and platforms.
- The emphasis is on a long-term **R&D** focus and a level playing field between the private and public sectors.

items.title: India indispensable new manufacturing hub, says Foxconn
items.summary: - *Taiwanese enterprises* are positioning *India* as an indispensable new manufacturing hub due to its vast domestic market, abundant talent, and strategic location.\n- At *Taiwan Expo 2025* (Sept 25â€“27), leaders like Foxconn highlight progress in sectors such as *semiconductors*, electronics manufacturing, ICT and smart machinery in India.\n- With a more-than-threefold rise in Taiwanese investment since 2017, the event underscores shifts in the *global supply chain* and potential long-term significance for India.

items.title: Nikhil Kamath to invest in commercial vehicle maker Blue Energy
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Nikhil Kamath *joins* a $30M round in **Blue Energy Motors**, marking his first investment in India's commercial-vehicle space.
- The round lifts total funding to **$50M**; Kamath's exact stake wasn't disclosed, with Omnitex participating.
- Blue Energy plans to expand into *electric trucks* and build a â‚¹3,500 crore EV plant in Maharashtra, signaling clean freight tech.

items.title: PMO reacts to pharma compliance concerns, shortages
items.summary:
- The *PMO* directed the *MSME* Ministry to act after pharma reps warned stricter norms could trigger *drug shortages* and threaten *health security*. 
- FOPE said only 1,700 of about 6,000 MSME units submitted **GMP** plans, risking shutdowns and over *500,000* jobs, and urged a two-year extension of Schedule-M. 
- It cited long **NOC** export processes and 'double standards' on NSQ recalls, calling for policy relief to avoid export losses.

items.title: JSW Neo buys Statkraft hydro unit in HP for â‚¹1,727 cr
items.summary:
- **JSW Neo Energy** buys Statkraftâ€™s hydro unit in Himachal Pradesh for â‚¹1,727 crore, signaling a big renewable push.
- The deal includes a planned **150 MW Tidong** hydro project on the Sutlej River, with Statkraft having funded most capex.
- This follows **JSW**â€™s earlier acquisitions like O2 Power and Mytrah Energy, expanding its clean-energy portfolio.

items.title: Airbus to set up R&D Centre in India
items.summary:
- Airbus to set up an **R&D Centre of Excellence** at *Gati Shakti Vishwavidyalaya* in Gujarat, sourcing **$1 billion+** worth components from 100+ Indian suppliers.
- Union Minister *Ashwini Vaishnaw* discussed Airbus' India presence with MD *JÃ¼rgen Westermeier*, underscoring the local ecosystem and R&D links.
- Airbus already runs a Bengaluru **Digital Centre**, employs over 3,600 people in India, and partners with premier Indian institutes for R&D.

items.title: India at inflection point: Growth in specialty chemicals
items.author: Anil Gupta
items.summary:
- India is at an **inflection point** to capture global demand in specialty chemicals by moving from volume to value and expanding into high-value areas like **EV materials** and **coatings**.
- Policy support (**PCPIRs**, **CPDS**) and faster approvals, plus scale and **R&D**, are essential to build world-class facilities and secure feedstocks.
- **China-plus-one** and growing domestic demand create opportunities, but India must accelerate **green chemistry** and sustainability to claim lasting global leadership.

items.title: Panasonic at Productronica India 2025: Autonomous solutions
items.summary:
- PSFSIN showcased automation and software-driven *smart factory solutions* at Productronica India 2025 under the theme **Autonomous Factory â€“ Skill-less Operation**.
- The demo featured the SMT line: *NPM-GPL* printer, *NPM-GH*, *NPM-TT2* modular placements, plus *PanaCIM*, *MirAIe ProFactory* and O&M support for autonomous manufacturing.
- Leaders highlighted India as a growing manufacturing hub and ROI benefits from advanced feeders and platforms designed to reduce *skill dependency* and boost productivity.

items.title: Indian Army rolls out first overhauled VT-72B armoured recovery vehicle
Huawei plans four Ascend AI chips to rival Nvidia
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Huawei plans four **Ascend AI chips** over three years, including Ascend 950, 960, and 970, to rival Nvidia.
- The Ascend 950 will use Huawei's own high-bandwidth memory and Atlas 950/960 systems will interconnect thousands of chips with a *supernode* architecture.
- Huawei frames this as part of China's push toward **domestic semiconductor manufacturing** to reduce dependence on US supply chains.

items.title: IFQM Symposium 2025 focuses on strengthening MSMEs and global competitiveness
Emmvee IPO gets SEBI nod for â‚¹3,000 cr
items.summary: - Emmvee Photovoltaic Power has received *SEBI* observations for an *â‚¹3,000 crore* IPO, comprising a fresh issue of â‚¹2,143.86 crore and an offer-for-sale of â‚¹856.14 crore by promoters.\n- Proceeds will be used to repay loans and for general corporate purposes, with up to â‚¹428.77 crore possibly raised via a pre-IPO placement.\n- The Bengaluru firm runs 7.80 GW module and 2.94 GW cell capacity (as of May 31, 2025); merchant bankers include JM Financial, IIFL Capital Services, Jefferies India and Kotak Mahindra, and Crisil notes sector growth.

items.title: Vedanta: 70% revenue from transition metals for green growth
items.summary:
- Vedanta derives *about 70%* of its top-line from **transition metals** and plans aluminium capacity to reach **3.1 MTPA** by FY28.
- It has secured **critical minerals** blocks (rare earths, vanadium, graphite, tungsten) to support Indiaâ€™s energy transition and self-reliance.
- The group targets **2.5 GW** of renewable capacity by 2030 with a **25%** emissions cut, from **1.9 GW** installed today.
